item.title: 硅谷推动人工智能进入美国学校的努力正在奏效
item.description:
全国各地的教育工作者正在将聊天机器人引入他们的教学计划。这是否有助于孩子们的学习，抑或只是另一种注定要失败的教育科技时尚？【原文：

Educators across the country are bringing chatbots into their lesson plans. Will it help kids learn or is it just another doomed ed-tech fad?

】

item.title: 瑞穗计划进行更多交易，以成为亚洲顶级投资银行
item.description: 瑞穗金融集团（Mizuho Financial Group Inc.【原文：Mizuho Financial Group Inc. is aiming to become Asia’s top investment bank by bolstering equity underwriting and M&A advisory, seeking to replicate the headways the firm has made in the US.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第二大养老金公司削减国债押注美国风险上升
item.description: 由于担心华盛顿的政策可能会刺激通货膨胀，澳大利亚第二大养老基金越来越看空美国国债。【原文：Australia’s second-biggest pension fund has grown increasingly bearish on US Treasuries due to concerns that Washington’s policies may stoke inflation.】

item.title: 泰国政局动荡威胁经济增长，降息预期升温
item.description: 随着泰国主要政党争相组建新政府，经济学家认为经济增长面临更多风险，大幅降息的可能性也在上升。【原文：With Thailand’s major political parties vying to form a new government — which may last only a few months — economists see further risks to economic growth and rising odds of steeper interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 德意志银行缺席七年后将重新加入欧洲斯托克 50 指数
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）在被剔除出欧元区主要股票基准七年后，重新跻身欧元区主要股票基准行列。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG has regained its spot in the euro area’s main stock benchmark, seven years after being cast out of the gauge.】

item.title: 阿根廷纸浆制造商寻求破产保护，将责任归咎于米莱公司
item.description: 纸浆和纸张制造商 Celulosa Argentina SA 周一申请破产保护，指责哈维尔-米莱伊总统的政府为当地工业创造了恶劣的商业环境。【原文：Pulp and paper manufacturer Celulosa Argentina SA filed for bankruptcy protection Monday, blaming the government of President Javier Milei for creating a bad business environment for local industry.】

item.title: 干扰欧盟委员会主席航班的 GPS 干扰是怎么回事？
item.description: 8 月 31 日，一架搭载欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）的飞机在飞往保加利亚普罗夫迪夫（Plovdiv）途中遭遇 GPS 导航故障，该国当局称信号很可能受到了俄罗斯的干扰。【原文：After a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suffered a GPS navigation outage on its approach to Plovdiv in Bulgaria on Aug. 31, authorities in the country said the signal had likely been jammed by Russia.】

item.title: CapVest 以 100 亿欧元收购 Stada，跃入 PE 巨头行列
item.description: 今年欧洲最大的杠杆收购并非由黑石集团或 KKR & Co.等华尔街巨头完成。Co.等华尔街巨头完成的，而是一家名不见经传的英国私募股权公司，该公司管理着 120 亿欧元（约合 140 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Europe’s largest leveraged buyout this year wasn’t done by a Wall Street giant like Blackstone Inc. or KKR & Co. Instead, it’s from a lesser-known British private equity firm that manages just €12 billion ($14 billion).】

item.title: 尼日利亚削减石油公司成本回收上限以增加预算收入
item.description: 在原油价格下跌有可能扩大西非国家预算赤字的情况下，尼日利亚为增加政府收入，降低了石油公司收回成本的门槛。【原文：Nigeria has set a lower threshold by which oil companies can recover their expenses as it seeks to boost government revenue amid lower crude oil prices threatening to widen the budget deficit in the West African nation.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷首创的掉期交易在战争时代焕发新生
item.description: 瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）为资助自然保护而首创的债务转换正在焕发第二春，因为银行家们看到了将这种模式应用于从战后重建到能源安全等一切领域的机会。【原文：Debt swaps pioneered by Credit Suisse to fund nature conservation are enjoying a second life, as bankers see an opportunity to apply the model to everything from post-war reconstruction to energy security.】

item.title: Glencore 考虑在南非铬铁企业裁员
item.description: Glencore Plc 在南非的铬铁合资企业表示，在关闭部分工厂数月后，该公司已开始进行重组谈判，这可能会导致裁员。【原文：Glencore Plc’s ferrochrome venture in South Africa said it’s started restructuring talks that may lead to job losses months after shuttering some of its plants.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯、伊拉克在制裁后停止向纳亚拉运送石油
item.description: 位于印度西部的纳亚拉能源有限公司炼油厂遭到欧盟制裁后，沙特阿拉伯和伊拉克不再向该炼油厂运送任何原油。【原文：Saudi Arabia and Iraq aren’t shipping any crude to Nayara Energy Ltd.’s refinery in western India after it was sanctioned by the European Union.】

item.title: 欧盟国家寻求堵住俄罗斯天然气输送漏洞
item.description: 欧盟国家正在想方设法堵住剩余的漏洞，以确保在 2027 年底禁令生效后，俄罗斯天然气不会偷偷混入欧盟的天然气供应中。【原文：European Union countries are looking to ways to plug any remaining loopholes to ensure that Russian gas won’t be furtively mixed into the bloc’s supplies once a ban takes effect by the end of 2027.】

item.title: 尼日利亚商业情绪保持乐观，创 2022 年以来最长纪录
item.description: 由于通胀放缓推动了对商品和服务的需求，尼日利亚私营部门的景气连续第九个月得到改善，这是自至少 2022 年以来最长的一段时期。【原文：Private sector sentiment in Nigeria improved for a ninth consecutive month, the longest stretch since at least 2022, as a slowdown in inflation drove demand for goods and services.】

item.title: 高盛支持的博伊德考虑出售热能业务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，随着数据中心对空气冷却系统需求的不断增长，博伊德公司（Boyd Corp.【原文：Boyd Corp. is exploring a sale of its thermal management solutions business, people familiar with the matter said, amid rising demand for air-cooling systems for data centers.】

item.title: 秘鲁通胀意外降温至七年低点
item.description: 秘鲁首都的通货膨胀率在 8 月份出乎意料地下降，而年通货膨胀率则放缓至七年来最慢。【原文：Inflation in Peru’s capital unexpectedly fell in the month of August, while the annual print slowed down to its slowest rate in seven years.】

item.title: 特朗普称印度主动提出将关税降至 "零
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，在美国上周对印度购买俄罗斯石油征收 50%的关税作为惩罚后，印度已提出降低关税税率。【原文：President Donald Trump said India has offered to cut its tariff rates following the US imposition last week of 50% levies as punishment for its purchases of Russian oil.】

item.title: 津巴布韦中央银行概述采用 ZiG 作为唯一货币的计划
item.description: 津巴布韦中央银行已设定了在黄金支持的 ZiG 于本十年末成为该国唯一货币之前必须实现的目标。【原文：Zimbabwe’s central bank has set targets it must achieve before the gold-backed ZiG becomes the nation’s sole currency by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 卢特尼克预测美国关税不确定性将推迟经济 "动力
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统最近在关税问题上遭遇的法律挫折增加了美国进口商的不确定性，同时推迟了商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）预测的政府将产生的经济红利。【原文：President Donald Trump’s latest legal setback on tariffs increases uncertainty for American importers while delaying the economic dividends Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick predicted the administration would generate.】

item.title: 英国养老金效率改革瞄准基金经理
item.description: 英国改革委员会（Reform UK）誓言要改变公共部门养老金的投资方式，因为它试图减少地方议会的浪费，并称基金的 "管理不善 "导致每年多达 100 亿英镑（135 亿美元）的收入损失和超额费用。【原文：Reform UK has vowed to change the way public sector pensions are invested as it attempts to cut waste in local councils, saying “mismanagement” of funds is costing as much as £10 billion ($13.5 billion) a year in missed earnings and excess fees.】

item.title: 澳大利亚将降雨后小麦产量预报上调至第四高水平
item.description: 澳大利亚预计将获得有史以来第四大小麦收成，由于冬季主要谷物产区降雨量超过预期，收成预测大幅上调。【原文：Australia is expecting its fourth-largest wheat harvest on record, with crop forecasts dramatically upgraded following heavier-than-expected rainfall across major grain belts during winter.】

item.title: 印度第一季度经常账户差额因服务业而缩小
item.description: 在服务业出口增长和汇款数额超出预期的帮助下，印度第一财政季度的经常账户缺口有所缩小。【原文：India’s current account gap narrowed in the fiscal first quarter, helped by an increase in service sector exports and larger than anticipated remittances.】

item.title: 投资者权衡关税法庭判决，美国股指期货保持稳定
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货变化不大，因为投资者正在权衡联邦上诉法院裁决的影响，该裁决认为唐纳德-特朗普总统的大部分全球关税都是非法的。【原文：US index futures were little changed on Monday as investors weighed the impact of federal appeals court ruling that deemed most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs as illegal.】

item.title: 中国领导的集团同意成立开发银行，习近平获胜
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平与伙伴国达成了建立新开发银行的协议，实现了长期以来的雄心壮志，展示了北京日益增长的影响力。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping secured an agreement from partner countries to set up a new development bank, realizing a longtime ambition in a display of Beijing’s growing influence.】

item.title: 石油交易商预计欧佩克+将在周末会议上维持石油产量不变
item.description: 石油交易商预计，"欧佩克+"将在本周末举行的会议上保持原油产量稳定，因为该组织在一系列加速增加供应之后将暂停生产。【原文：Oil traders expect OPEC+ to hold crude production steady when it meets this weekend, as the group pauses after a series of accelerated supply increases.】

item.title: 世界上最宜居的城市之一，终结欧洲一日游通票
item.description: 公共财政的紧缩迫使维也纳 13 年来首次提高了公共交通年票的价格，结束了每天一欧元、可无限次乘坐市内公共汽车、有轨电车和地下地铁的票价。【原文：A crunch in public finances is forcing Vienna to increase the cost of its annual public transport ticket for the first time in 13 years, ending a euro-a-day fare for unlimited travel on city buses, trams and underground subways.】

item.title: 智利经济活动自四月以来首次出现月度增长
item.description: 智利第三季度经济在采矿业的推动下实现了稳健的月度扩张，国内经济活动的步伐成为今年总统大选前的核心主题。【原文：Chile’s economy kicked off the third quarter with solid monthly expansion driven by mining, as the pace of domestic activity becomes a central theme ahead of this year’s presidential election.】

item.title: 南非农业企业因动物疾病和关税而情绪低落
item.description: 由于南非农业面临口蹄疫疫情和美国新关税制度，衡量南非农业企业情绪的一项指标连续第二个季度下降。【原文：A gauge measuring sentiment among South African agricultural businesses declined for a second straight quarter as the industry grapples with a foot-and-mouth disease outbreak and the new tariff regime in the US.】

item.title: 斯塔默在哥伦比亚大学任职期间经历波折后任命沙菲克为顾问
item.description: 首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）任命米努什-沙菲克（Minouche Shafik）为其首席经济顾问，这极大地扩展了唐宁街的国际金融经验，但却有可能重新引发有关她在领导纽约哥伦比亚大学期间的动荡经历的争论。【原文：In naming Minouche Shafik as his chief economic adviser, Prime Minister Keir Starmer has dramatically expanded Downing Street’s international financial experience at the risk of reopening debates about her tumultuous tenure leading New York’s Columbia University.】

item.title: 肯尼亚计划根据新法于 9 月拍卖 10 个石油区块
item.description: 肯尼亚计划在六年前通过管理石油行业的新立法以来的第一轮许可证发放中提供 10 个石油勘探区块。【原文：Kenya plans to offer 10 oil exploration blocks in the first licensing round since it adopted new legislation six years ago to govern the petroleum sector.】
